request.description:
This endpoint is used to initiate the process for getting the customer's consent. The integrator is required to pass the customer's BVN and the phone number. If the phone number passed does not match the customer phone on record, an error is returned but with a masked collection of the correct phone and email on the customer account.

#### Request Body

| Field | Type | Description |
| --- | --- | --- |
| contact | `String` | The phone number or email of the customer. At the minimum, the phone number must be the one registered to the BVN (e.g., 08012345678, [ado@example.com](https://mailto:ado@example.com)). |

request.description:
This endpoint is used to get the BVN data after the customer's consent has been approved.

### Response fields

| Field | Type | Description |
| --- | --- | --- |
| reference | `integer` | Unique reference number (e.g., 10000001) |
| bvn | `string` | Bank Verification Number (e.g., "22123456789") |
| first_name | `string` | First name of the individual (e.g., "ADO") |
| middle_name | `string` | Middle name of the individual (e.g., "JOHN") |
| last_name | `string` | Last name of the individual (e.g., "SULE") |
| dob | `date` | Date of birth in YYYY-MM-DD format (e.g., "1990-10-31") |
| formatted_dob | `date` | Formatted date of birth (e.g., "1990-10-31") |
| mobile2 | `string` | Secondary mobile number, if applicable (e.g., 08012345678) |
| mobile | `string` | Primary mobile number (e.g., "08012345678") |
| registration_date | `string` | Date of registration (e.g., "30-Mar-2015") |
| enrollment_bank | `string` | Bank enrollment number (e.g., "044") |
| enrollment_branch | `string` | Branch of enrollment (e.g., "RET SHOP - BABCOCK UNIVERSITY (137)") |
| email | `string` | Email address (e.g., "[wunmi@yahoo.com](https://mailto:wunmi@yahoo.com)") |
| gender | `string` | Gender (e.g., "Male") |
| level_of_account | `string` | Level of account, if applicable (e.g., Tier 2) |
| lga_of_origin | `string` | Local Government Area of origin (e.g., "Abeokuta South") |
| lga_of_residence | `string` | Local Government Area of residence (e.g., "Abeokuta South") |
| marital_status | `string` | Marital status (e.g., "Single") |
| nin | `string` | National Identification Number, if applicable (e.g., 1234567890) |
| name_on_card | `string` | Name as it appears on card (e.g., "ADO JOHN SULE") |
| nationality | `string` | Nationality, if applicable (e.g., American) |
| residential_address | `string` | Residential address (e.g., "Ogun State") |
| state_of_origin | `string` | State of origin (e.g., "Ogun State") |
| state_of_residence | `string` | State of residence (e.g., "Ogun State") |
| watchlisted | `integer` | Watchlist status (e.g., 0 for not watchlisted) |
| image_url | `string` | URL of the photo (e.g., "[https://picsum.photos/id/1/5000/3333"](https://picsum.photos/id/1/5000/3333)) |

request.description:
The Lendsqr ecosystem provides an aggregated view of borrowers which lenders could have access to make decisions. To access this service, the lender must provide an evidence of customer explicit consent.

Furthermore, where it is proven that a consent was never provided, the lender would be liable for all legal cost required to ameliorate issues that may arise. Lender may also be removed from the platform.

This endpoint is used to verify if a borrower exists on the Lendsqr ecosystem.

#### Path Variables

`bvn`: `required` BVN no. of the person to be checked.

#### Response Fields

| Field | Type | Description |
| --- | --- | --- |
| bvn | `string` | Bank Verification Number (e.g., "22536011111") |
| first_name | `string` | First name of the individual (e.g., "JANE") |
| last_name | `string` | Last name of the individual (e.g., "DOE") |
| bvn_phone_number | `string` | Phone number registered with BVN (e.g., "07062561111") |
| date_of_birth | `date` | Date of birth in ISO format (e.g., "1997-09-10") |
| age | `integer` | Age of the individual (e.g., 25) |
| unique_phone_numbers | `integer` | Count of unique phone numbers (e.g., 0) |
| phone_number | `string` | Primary phone number (e.g., "07062561111") |
| unique_emails | `integer` | Count of unique email addresses (e.g., 0) |
| email | `string` | Email address (e.g., "[janedoe@gmail.com](https://mailto:janedoe@gmail.com)") |
| gender | `string` | Gender of the individual (e.g., "Female") |
| lenders | `integer` | Number of lenders interacted with (e.g., 1) |
| first_account | `date` | Date of first account creation in ISO format (e.g., "2020-11-16") |
| last_account | `date` | Date of last account creation in ISO format (e.g., "2023-06-26") |
| failed_selfie_bvn_check | `integer` | Number of failed BVN selfie checks (e.g., 0) |
| lending_lenders | `integer` | Number of lending lenders (e.g., 0) |
| loans | `integer` | Total number of loans (e.g., 0) |
| loan_amount | `integer` | Total loan amount (e.g., 0) |
| loan_amount_minimum | `integer` | Minimum loan amount (e.g., 0) |
| loan_amount_maximum | `integer` | Maximum loan amount (e.g., 150000) |
| loan_amount_average | `float` | Average loan amount (e.g., 5892.954545) |
| settled_loans | `integer` | Number of settled loans (e.g., 0) |
| settled_loan_amount | `integer` | Amount of settled loans (e.g., 0) |
| settled_loan_amount_paid | `integer` | Amount paid for settled loans (e.g., 0) |
| running_loans | `integer` | Number of running loans (e.g., 0) |
| running_loan_amount | `integer` | Amount of running loans (e.g., 0) |
| past_due_loans | `integer` | Number of past due loans (e.g., 0) |
| past_due_loan_amount | `integer` | Amount of past due loans (e.g., 0) |
| past_due_loan_amount_due | `integer` | Amount due for past due loans (e.g., 2000) |
| penalty | `integer` | Penalty amount (e.g., 0) |
| penalty_paid | `integer` | Penalty amount paid (e.g., 0) |
| delayed_paid_loans | `integer` | Number of delayed paid loans (e.g., 0) |
| delayed_paid_loan_amount | `integer` | Amount of delayed paid loans (e.g., 0) |
| delayed_paid_loans_trials | `integer` | Trials for delayed paid loans (e.g., 0) |
| delayed_paid_loans_avg | `integer` | Average trials for delayed paid loans (e.g., 0) |
| delayed_paid_loans_trials_max | `integer` | Maximum trials for delayed paid loans (e.g., 0) |
| delayed_paid_loans_trials_min | `integer` | Minimum trials for delayed paid loans (e.g., 0) |
| first_loan_date | `date` | Date of first loan in ISO format (e.g., "2020-12-24") |
| last_loan_date | `date` | Date of last loan in ISO format (e.g., "2023-07-20") |
| loan_requests | `integer` | Number of loan requests (e.g., 0) |
| failed_loan_requests | `integer` | Number of failed loan requests (e.g., 0) |
| logins | `integer` | Number of logins (e.g., 115) |
| first_login | `date` | Date of first login in ISO format (e.g., "2023-06-01") |
| last_login | `date` | Date of last login in ISO format (e.g., "2023-08-08") |
| unique_login_ips | `integer` | Count of unique login IPs (e.g., 0) |
| unique_device_ids | `integer` | Count of unique device IDs (e.g., 0) |
| distinct_mobile_os | `integer` | Count of distinct mobile OS used (e.g., 0) |
| duplicated_devices | `integer` | Count of duplicated devices (e.g., 0) |
| shared_device_users | `integer` | Count of shared device users (e.g., 0) |
| credit_delinquency | `integer` | Credit delinquency flag (e.g., 0) |
| processed_on | `date` | Date when the data was processed in ISO format (e.g., "2023-08-08") |

request.description:
This endpoint allows for real-time verification of an individual's National Identification Number (NIN) , thereby providing an additional layer of security and accuracy in customer information validation.

#### Path Variables

nin: `required` NIN of the person to be checked.

#### Response Fields

| Field | Type | Description |
| --- | --- | --- |
| nin | `string` | Bank Verification Number (e.g., "70123456789") |
| first_name | `string` | First name of the individual (e.g., "John") |
| middle_name | `string` | Middle name of the individual (e.g., "Frank") |
| last_name | `string` | Last name of the individual (e.g., "Doe") |
| dob | `date` | Date of birth in ISO format (e.g., "1997-09-10") |
| mobile | `string` | Primary phone number (e.g., "08081234561") |
| registration_date | `string` | User NIN registeration date in ISO format (e.g., "2020-01-01") |
| email | `string` | Email address (e.g., "[johndoe@example.com](https://mailto:johndoe@example.com)") |
| gender | `string` | Gender of the individual (e.g., "Female") |
| marital_status | `string` | Marital Status of the individual (e.g., "Single") |
| state_of_residence | `string` | State of Residence of the individual (e.g., "Lagos") |
| image_url | `string` | NIN Image Url (e.g. [https://documents.lendsqr.com/image_url.png](https://documents.lendsqr.com/image_url.png)) |

item.description:
The Validation APIs are resources and tools for validating customer information. These validation processes make use of APIs that allow you to confirm the accuracy of customer information using their Bank Verification Numbers (BVNs), email addresses, or phone numbers.

The APIs are designed to help you ensure that customer information is accurate and up-to-date, providing you with a reliable and efficient method for validating customer data.

request.description:
This endpoint is used for scoring based on the passed parameters.

The Lendsqr data provides the source of data that have been used to develop and optimize our proprietary scoring algorithms. The scoring system is continually updated to reflect new insights into the shifting borrower’s behaviors both for cohorts of customers and for the Nigerian financial system. The ID variable refers to the ID of the decision model.

#### Request Payload

| Property | Type | Examples |
| --- | --- | --- |
| `gender` | `string` | male, female |
| `marital_status` | `string` | married, single, divorced, separated, widowed |
| `age` | integer | 25, 37 |
| `location` | `string` | Lagos, Ibadan |
| `no_of_dependent` | integer | 0, 5 |
| `type_of_residence` | `string` | own house, rented apartment, parents apartment |
| `education_attainment` | `string` | MSc and above, BSc, HND and Other Equivalent, Diploma/School Cert, Others |
| `employment_status` | `string` | employed, self employed, unemployed, retired |
| `sector_of_employment` | `string` | agriculture, banking, education, law |
| `tier` | `string` | tier 1. tier 2 |
| `monthly_net_income` | `string` | 700,000 -999,999, above 1,000,000, |
| `employment_category` | `string` | artisan, enterprise, private company, federal: public |
| `bvn` | `string` | 22222222222 |
| `phone_number` | `string` | 0805555555 |
| `working_period` | integer | 1 |
| `time_with_current_employer` | integer | 1 |
| `previous_lendsqr_loans` | integer | 1 |
| `code` | `string` | 56etruu |
| `phone` | `string` | 08106666666 |
| `bvn_phone` | `string` | 08106666666 |
| `official_email` | `string` | [male@female.com](https://) |
| `personal_email` | `string` | [male@female.com](https://) |
| `amount` | `string` | 5000 |

request.description:
Using the product ID that has been retrieved from the GET loan products endpoint, make a call to this endpoint to generate the web page URL that can be embedded within your web or mobile platform. The request body also allows for meta fields that would prepoulate and disable these form fields within the the web page > NOTE: All fields on the web page would be disabled except email and phone number as these details may be different on the lender's plaform. ### Meta fields | Property | Type | Details | **Options** | | --- | --- | --- | --- | | `requested_amount` | number | This should be the amount the customer wants to check out with (BNPL) or has requested.
Currency is in Naira | NA | | `proposed_tenor` | number | This is the duration for the loan before repayment kicks in. The range for this is decided by the loan product selected however customers can specify any value within that range. | NA | | `proposed_tenor_period` | `string` | This is the measurement of time that drives the proposed_tenor entered | days
weeks
months | | `gender` | `string` | male, female | male;
female | | `marital_status` | `string` | The marital status of the user | married;
single;
divorced;
separated;
widowed | | `location` | `string` | The residential state of the user | States only:
Lagos;
Oyo etc. | | `no_of_dependent` | integer | 0, 5 | 0,
5 etc. | | `type_of_residence` | `string` | The type of home residence the user lives in. There are currently three options | own house,
rented apartment, parents apartment | | `education_attainment` | `string` | The highest level of eductaional attainment by the user. There are currently four options | MSc and above;
BSc, HND and Other Equivalent;
Diploma/School Cert; Others | | `employment_status` | `string` | The employment status of the user. There are currently four options | employed,
self employed, unemployed,
retired | | `bvn` | `string` | 22222222222 | NA | | `phone_number` | `string` | 0805555555 | | | `working_period` | integer | 1 | | | `time_with_current_employer` | integer | 1 | | | `bvn_phone` | `string` | 08106666666 | | | `official_email` | `string` | [male@female.com](https://) | | | `personal_email` | `string` | [male@female.com](https://) | | | `amount` | `string` | 5000 | |

request.description:
This endpoints returns the lis of banks able to provide direct debit authorizations on their customers' accounts.

#### Response Body Fields

| Field | Type | Description |
| --- | --- | --- |
| id | `Integer` | Unique identifier for the bank. |
| name | `string` | Name of the bank. |
| bank_code | `string` | This is the CBN code associated with the bank. It is usually 3 digits for commercial banks and 5 digits for microfinance banks. |
| institution_code | `string` | This is the NIBSS code associated with the bank. It is is usually 6 digits long. For commercial banks, the code is in the format 0000XX where X is from 0 to 99. |
| url | `string` | URL pointing to the bank's logo or image. |

request.description:
Retrieve the details of a specific account.

#### Query Params

| Field | Type | Description |
| --- | --- | --- |
| bank_id | `Integer` | **Required**. The ID of the bank you want to get the details of. |

#### Response Body Field

| Field | Type | Description |
| --- | --- | --- |
| status | `string` | The status of the response. |
| message | `string` | A message indicating the result of the operation. |
| data | `object` | The data object contains specific information related to the response. |
| ID | `number` | The ID associated with the bank. |
| bank | `string` | The name of the bank. |
| bank_code | `string` | The bank code associated with the bank. |
| institutional_code | `string` | The institution code associated with the bank. |
| url | `string` | The URL pointing to the bank's logo image |

response.name: Get Details of a Bank

item.description:
These endpoints are used to get the list of Nigerian banks, details of specific banks. They can also be used to bank account verification.

#### Note

Not all banks are included as some banks have either not implemented their direct debit service, or they return DO NOT HONOR on direct debit requests.

If a bank is missing, please email [support@lendsqr.com](https://mailto:support@lendsqr.com) for assistance or more details.

request.description:
This endpoint allows you to create a mandate on a customer's account. The default mandate type is the emandate, which customer can easily activate by themselves. #### Creating a manual direct debit mandate However, you can also create a manual mandate, which includes scanned written authorization by the bank. The use case for this may be creation of mandates on a joint account requiring more than one signatory or a company account where the company instructions specify how instructions must be handled. When creating a manual mandate, there are a few things to note: - You must have an irrefutable document from a customer, duly signed off, that provides you with the authorization to create a mandate. This document, which should be a PDF or a PNG, would be converted to Base64 when creating the mandate. - The manual mandate is immediate sent to the customer banks. However, banks may delay to approve this, therefore, the customer may have to follow up on their banks to get this approved on the system. #### Request Body Fields | Field | Type | Description | | --- | --- | --- | | account_number | `string` | **Required.** Customer NUBAN account number to create the mandate against | | phone_number | `string` | **Required.** The phone number of the customer. The number should be in the form `08012345678`.

The customer's bank may validate this phone number against what they have on record. Therefore you are advised to use the number that the customer uses to receive SMS messages from their bank. | | debit_type | `string` | **Required.** The type of debit which may be `all` or `partial`.

When set to `all` the system will try to debit the full amount due and when set to `partial` the system will try as much as possible to debit whatever amount can be recover from the customer account.

The `partial` method is useful for loan repayments. | | frequency | `string` | The frequency of debiting the mandates. (`daily`, `weekly`, `monthly`)
`required` if the | | bank_id | `Number` | **Required.** The `id` of the bank of the customer bank, is obtained from the Get Bank endpoint. | | email | `string` | **Required.** Customer email address. | | start_date | `string` | **Required.** The `start date` of the mandate. A mandate cannot be trigger for transactions before the `start date`. | | end_date | `string` | **Required.** The `end date` of the mandate. The mandate will expire on the last day. | | narration | `string` | **Required.** The narration or description of the mandate. | | address | `string` | **Required.** Customer address. | | amount | `Number` | **Required**. The maximum amount that can be debited on the mandate at a single time. However, the total amount debited against a mandate depends on how frequent the API to debit a mandate is called.

Therefore, in theory, the total amount debited against a mandate may be multiples of the maximum amount that can be debited at once. | | schedule | `Boolean` | Indicates whether the transaction is scheduled (true) or not (false). | | type | `string` | Indicates whether the mandate is an e-mandate (emandate) or a manual mandate (manual). | | file_base64 | `string` | **Required.** The Base64 encoded data equivalent to the customer's mandate letter. | | file_extension | `string` | **`optional`****.** The extension of the file that has been added as a base64 data. It is usually `pdf` or `png`. | #### Response Body Fields | Field | Type | Description | | --- | --- | --- | | id | `Integer` | The ID of the created mandate. | | account_number | `string` | The account number associated with the mandate. | | reference_number | `string` | A reference number assigned to the mandate. | | account_name | `string` | The account name associated with the mandate. | | frequency | `string` | The frequency of the mandate (e.g., "daily", "weekly", "monthly"). | | bvn | `string` | The Bank Verification Number (BVN) associated with the mandate. | | phone_number | `string` | The phone number associated with the mandate. | | email | `string` | The email address associated with the mandate. | | start_date | `string` | The start date of the mandate. | | end_date | `string` | The end date of the mandate. | | narration | `string` | The narration or description of the mandate. | | address | `string` | The address associated with the mandate. | | amount | `string` | The amount associated with the mandate. | | status | `string` | The status of the mandate (e.g., "initiated", "active", "inactive"). | | workflow_status | `string` | The workflow status of the mandate. | | debit_type | `string` | The debit type of the mandate (e.g., "all" or "partial"). | | type | `string` | The type of the mandate (e.g., "emandate" or "manual"). | | schedule | `Boolean` | Indicates whether the transaction is scheduled (true) or not (false). | | created_on | `string` | The date and time when the mandate was created in ISO 8601 format. |

request.description:
Retrieve the transactions related to the mandates associated with the API key.

#### Response Body Fields

| Field | Type | Description |
| --- | --- | --- |
| id | `integer` | The ID of the transaction. |
| amount | String | The amount of the transaction. |
| mandate_id | `integer` | The ID of the associated mandate. |
| mandate_account_name | String | The account name associated with the mandate. |
| mandate_account_number | `integer` | The account number associated with the mandate. |
| mandate_bvn | String | The Bank Verification Number (BVN) associated with the mandate. |
| reference | String | The reference number of the transaction. |
| narration | String | The description or purpose of the transaction. |
| beneficiary_id | `integer` | The ID of the recipient of the mandate debits. |
| beneficiary_account_name | String | The account name of the recipient of the mandate debits. |
| beneficiary_account_number | `integer` | The account number of the recipient of the mandate debits. |
| beneficiary_bvn | String | The Bank Verification Number (BVN) of the beneficiary. |
| session_id | String | The session ID associated with the transaction. |
| status | String | The status of the transaction (e.g., success, failed). |
| created_on | String | The date and time when the transaction was created. |
| mandate_bank | `object` | The bank details associated with the mandate (see bank fields below). |

#### Mandate Bank Fields

| Field | Type | Description |
| --- | --- | --- |
| id | `integer` | The ID of the bank. |
| name | String | The name of the bank. |
| bank_code | String | The bank code associated with the bank. |
| institution_code | String | The institution code associated with the bank. |
| url | String | The URL of the bank (if available). |

item.description:
## Getting started Direct debit is a payment method that allows an account holder to grant authorization for a biller or lender to take money from their bank account for services as of when due. Direct debit is similar to debit cards in its ability to debit a customer’s account with prior authorization. Direct debit helps businesses that require recurring payments on specific dates with fixed amounts, such as insurance premiums, loan repayments, service subscriptions, or variable recurring payments on different dates (e.g., postpaid lines, and electricity usage). This direct debit API facilitates the process for Service Providers (referred to as Billers) to generate debit mandate instructions on their client's/customers' bank accounts for services rendered or products sold. These debit mandate instructions are created as digital versions of physical instructions duly signed by the account owners (clients/customers). Once generated, the mandate instructions are automatically sent to the bank where the account is held for review and approval. The approval process requires the bank to contact the account owner to authorize the mandate, which typically takes 24 to 48 hours. The system automatically assigns a unique mandate code to each initiated mandate. This mandate code is used to initiate a direct debit transaction on the bank account associated with the debit mandate instruction. This document provides a comprehensive overview and detailed specifications of the Direct Debit APIs, including all the necessary information for seamless integration into your respective applications. ## Direct debit process Direct debit mandates follow a streamlined process that may take at least 2 hours from activation to when they are available for debits. These steps are: - Mandate creation - Mandate activation - Setup for debit - Transactions ### Mandate creation The first step is the creation of mandate using the API defined in this collection. As soon as the mandate is created, you should inform the customer of the next steps about how to activate the mandate. From a best practices point of view, the customer should be informed on your app, by email, and SMS. ### Mandate activation Activation of the mandate is usually done by the transfer of a N50 (or N100 for banks where the minimum transfer amount is N100) to designated bank accounts operated by NIBSS. The customer has 168 hours (7 days) to send this amount if not the mandate is automatically canceled. Immediately the activation amount is received at either of the banks, the mandate is automatically activated. However, it is not available for debit at this time. #### Banks for mandate activation The following are the authorized banks which customers should use for direct debit mandate activation. | **Fidelity Bank** | **Paystack Titan** | | --- | --- | | Account: 9020025928
Bank: Fidelity Bank Plc.
You can transfer from USSD, mobile app or internet banking | Account: 9880218357
Bank: Paystack-Titan
You can transfer from your mobile app and internet banking | ### Setup for debit There are usually some backend processes done by NIBSS that then processes the accounts for debit and this may take up to 2 hours before completion. If you try to debit the mandate before this time, it would return an error message such as "do not honor".

item.description:
> Kolo transactional data is still in beta consequently, a few things may not work as expected. If you encounter any bugs, please email support@lendsqr.com. 
  

### Introduction

[Kolo](https://lsq.li/kolo?s=documentation) is a financial management application that consolidates all your bank accounts into a single platform. With Kolo, users can view balances, transactions, categorize spending, and much more. Our API extends these functionalities, allowing developers to integrate Kolo’s features into their applications. This API enables the tracking of bank balances and transactions, giving you a glimpse of your customers financial health.

### Getting Started

To use the Kolo API, customers need to:

1. **Create an Account**: Users must sign up for an account with [Kolo](https://lsq.li/kolo-app?s=documentation).
    
2. **Grant Permissions**: Users need to authorize the API to access their bank account information.
    

### Authentication

The Kolo API uses OAuth 2.0 for authentication. Ensure that you have valid credentials and have completed the necessary authorization steps to interact with the endpoints.

item.description:
The APIs in this folder are specifically designed to handle authentication operations, including the generation and management of tokens required for secure access to other core service APIs.

#### Auth Endpoint Functionality

The Auth endpoint is responsible for issuing the `x-access-token`, a critical component for accessing APIs within the core services collection. This token must be used in conjunction with the Bearer token to authorize subsequent API requests.

#### Making Auth API Calls

When invoking the Auth endpoint, ensure that the Bearer token is included in the request headers to authenticate the call. This token acts as your application's API key and is mandatory for successfully obtaining the `x-access-token`.

This section details the APIs that facilitate core operations for managing customers, accounts, direct debits, cards, loans, transactions, and logs. These APIs are integral to developing custom loan applications and seamlessly integrating with Lendsqr's platform.

### Authentication and Token Management

#### Accessing Core Services APIs

To interact with any API within this core services collection (excluding the `Auth` endpoint), the following authentication mechanisms must be implemented:

- **Bearer Token:** This token, which serves as the API key, is generated via your application on Adjutor.
    
- **x-access-token Header:** This token is retrieved from the Auth endpoint. After providing valid credentials (email and password) in the request body, the response will include the token. This token must be included in the headers of subsequent API requests as `x-access-token`.
    

#### Steps to Obtain Authentication Tokens

1. **Lendsqr Admin Console Sign-Up:**
    
    - Create an account on the [Lendsqr admin console](https://app.lendsqr.com) to initiate the process.
        
2. **Team Member Setup:**
    
    - Add a team member to your organization using a unique email. This member will manage all API interactions through the admin console. [Learn more](https://lendsqr.freshdesk.com/support/solutions/articles/44002359125-how-to-add-a-team-member)
        
3. **Adjutor Access and API Key Generation:**
    
    - The designated team member can access the [Adjutor](https://app.adjutor.io) platform with the credentials set up on the admin console. Once logged in, they can create an application and retrieve the API key, which acts as the Bearer Token.
        
4. **Auth Endpoint Token Retrieval:**
    
    - Use the email and password of the team member to call the Auth endpoint. The response will include the `x-access-token`, which must be included in the header of all core service API requests.
        

#### Important Considerations

- Once the team member's credentials have been used to authenticate API calls, those credentials will no longer be valid for accessing the admin console. Ensure proper management of credentials to maintain access control.
